docs.title: Welcome to the Heritage Samples Registry
docs.text:
The Heritage Samples Registry is an emerging international initiative to support the persistent identification, discovery, and sharing of information about heritage science samples. These samples — including paint cross-sections, material fragments, reference standards, and other physical specimens — are valuable research assets that underpin conservation, technical analysis, and heritage science worldwide.

The Registry aims to make the existence of these samples findable, citable, and consistently documented, enabling researchers and institutions to connect local sample records with global research outputs.

docs.title: What this site provides
docs.text: This documentation website offers:

docs.title: Introduction to IGSNs
docs.text: A clear explanation of the International Generic Sample Number (IGSN) system, how IGSN–DOIs work, and why they are suitable for identifying heritage samples.

docs.title: Registry Schema and Metadata Structure
docs.text: An overview of the draft metadata schema used for registering samples, including which fields are required, how local identifiers are handled, and how the schema extends IGSN-DOI requirements for heritage contexts.

docs.title: Instructions for Contributors
docs.text: Guidance for institutions, laboratories, and researchers on how to: - prepare sample metadata, - submit sample records, - register interest in participating, - integrate the Registry into existing documentation systems.

docs.title: Consortium Information
docs.text: Details about the organisations currently supporting the initiative, and how institutions can join the consortium as it grows.

docs.title: Current status
docs.text:
The Registry is under active development with international partners. During this phase the goals are to:

  • test the metadata model with a diverse set of real sample records,
  • refine workflows for assigning IGSN–DOIs to heritage samples,
  • gather feedback from institutions and researchers,
  • build a sustainable governance and technical framework for long-term use.

As work progresses, additional sections of this documentation will be expanded to include validation tools, implementation examples, and community guidelines.

docs.title: Get involved
docs.text:
Institutions or researchers interested in contributing to the development of the Registry, or in assigning IGSNs to their heritage samples, are warmly invited to contact the project team.

📧 info@heritagesamples.org

Your feedback, expertise, and participation will help shape a shared, international approach to heritage sample documentation and identification.

docs.title: Heritage Sample Schema
docs.text:
This page provides an early technical overview of the schema used by the Heritage Samples Registry for assigning IGSNs and managing core metadata.

Draft status

The schema described here is a working draft and will evolve as the Registry develops and the consortium expands.

docs.title: 1. Purpose
docs.text:
The Heritage Sample Schema is designed to:

  • ensure every registered sample can receive a valid IGSN–DOI,
  • capture the minimal, internationally consistent metadata required for cross-institution discovery,
  • preserve alignment with domain-specific local systems (e.g., paintings, archaeological objects, geological collections).
